description: Removal of existing bay window to rear ground floor, erection of ground floor rear extension and replacement of existing sash windows and front door
decision_conditions: <p>Prior to the commencement of the relevant part of works, detailed elevation and section drawings at a scale of 1:20 and/or 1:50 shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, the details shall show the new windows to have integrated glazing bars, glazing thickness of 12mm, no horns and finished in a putty finish. The development shall only be implemented in accordance with the approved details.&nbsp;</p><p>REASON: In order to preserve the appearance of the host property, terrace, wider streetscene and De Beauvoir Conservation Area.&nbsp;<br></p>

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

<p>All new external facing and roofing materials in respect of all the works hereby approved shall match those of the existing building in respect of materials used, detailed execution and finished appearance unless otherwise shown on the hereby approved plans.&nbsp;</p><p>

REASON: In order to preserve the appearance of the host building, terrace, wider streetscene and De Beauvoir Conservation Area.&nbsp;</p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-174e6a2d-7fff-c93f-814c-c787392f7b5b"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">Prior to superstructure works, detailed specification, a drainage layout and a management &amp; maintenance plan (where applicable) of at least one suitable sustainable drainage system (i.e. water butt with overflow, raingarden, bioretention planter box, living roof (substrate depth of 80-150 mm excluding the vegetative mat), permeable paving etc.) shall be submitted to, and approved by the LPA, in consultation with the LLFA. If soakaways i.e. plastic modules and soakaway rings are used, an infiltration test must be carried out to ensure that the capacity of the soil is suitable for infiltration. It must be demonstrated that there will be no increase in surface water flow being discharged offsite and an overall reduction in peak flow rate and volume.</span></span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-174e6a2d-7fff-c93f-814c-c787392f7b5b"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline;"><br></span></span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-174e6a2d-7fff-c93f-814c-c787392f7b5b"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">REASON:&nbsp; To ensure the provision of adequate SUDS onsite to minimise risk of flooding on site and in the surrounding area.&nbsp;&nbsp;<br></span></span><br></p>

<p>The flat roof of the extension hereby permitted shall not be used as an outdoor amenity area and shall only be accessed for maintenance purposes.&nbsp;</p><p>REASON: To safeguard the amenity of the neighbouring residents.&nbsp;</p>
